headline.main: For Some Studios, Oscar Is Golden

docs.snippet: LEAD: At hand are the five newest major-label recordings of mainstream Verdi and Rossini operas, and there is no use in delaying the report that all five are unsatisfying. A grand old maestro with offbeat casting, dedicated restudying of scores th...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: At hand are the five newest major-label recordings of mainstream Verdi and Rossini operas, and there is no use in delaying the report that all five are unsatisfying. A grand old maestro with offbeat casting, dedicated restudying of scores through critical editions, a defiant stand in favor of ''traditional'' interpretation, superstar casting - nothing seems to work.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Today's election in Nicaragua may finally break the fever. For 10 years, successive Republican Administrations in Washington have relentlessly distorted diplomacy and even traduced the law, all in fear of a small and impoverished neighbor in Central America. This has been so consuming a preoccupation of the U.S.

docs.snippet: LEAD: For video people, the movie ''Lethal Weapon 2,'' a cop-buddy hit starring Mel Gibson and Danny Glover, is turning into a thriller off-screen as well as on. Warner released the film, which is rated R, on Feb. 8 at the price of $24.98, meaning...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: For video people, the movie ''Lethal Weapon 2,'' a cop-buddy hit starring Mel Gibson and Danny Glover, is turning into a thriller off-screen as well as on. Warner released the film, which is rated R, on Feb. 8 at the price of $24.98, meaning that the studio thinks it should sell better than it rents.

headline.main: Sweet Rite of Passage for High School Star

docs.snippet: LEAD: Malcolm Forbes, chairman and editor in chief of Forbes magazine and one of the country's most flamboyant multimillionaires whose enthusiastic pursuits included yachting, motorcycling and ballooning, died yesterday of a heart attack in his sl...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Malcolm Forbes, chairman and editor in chief of Forbes magazine and one of the country's most flamboyant multimillionaires whose enthusiastic pursuits included yachting, motorcycling and ballooning, died yesterday of a heart attack in his sleep at his home in Far Hills, N.J. He was 70 years old.
